TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi beforefieldinit MenuItemStyleCollectionEditor extends System.ComponentModel.Design.CollectionEditor

Docs.summary: Provides a component editor for objects in the associated control.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.MenuItemStyleCollectionEditor> class provides a user interface for editing the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.MenuItemStyle> elements of <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.MenuItemStyleCollection> objects in the associated <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Menu> control at design time, under the control of the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.MenuDesigner> object.
There is a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.MenuItemStyleCollection> associated with each of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Menu.LevelMenuItemStyles%2A> and <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Menu.LevelSelectedStyles%2A> properties of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Menu> control. These <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.MenuItemStyleCollection> objects are used to apply styles to menu items that depend on their level (nesting depth) in the menu structure.
The <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.MenuItemStyleCollectionEditor> is invoked, for example, by selecting the ellipsis button (**…**) on the **LevelMenuItemStyles** or **LevelSelectedStyles** row in the **Properties** grid of the visual designer.
The <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.MenuItemStyleCollectionEditor.CanSelectMultipleInstances%2A> method always returns `false` to indicate that only one object can be selected at a time in the editor. The <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.MenuItemStyleCollectionEditor.CreateCollectionForm%2A> method creates a new form to display and edit the current <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.MenuItemStyleCollection>.
The <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.MenuItemStyleCollectionEditor.CreateInstance%2A> method creates a new instance of the specified collection item type. The <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.MenuItemStyleCollectionEditor.CreateNewItemTypes%2A> method returns an array of types that the editor can create.
## Examples The following code example shows how to use the <xref:System.ComponentModel.EditorAttribute> attribute to associate the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.MenuItemStyleCollectionEditor> and <xref:System.Drawing.Design.UITypeEditor> classes (the collection editor base class) with a property in a custom control, derived from the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebControl> class, that gets and sets a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.MenuItemStyleCollection> collection.
[!code-csharp[System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.MenuEditors#4](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_WebNet/System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.MenuEditors/CS/MenuEditors.cs#4)] [!code-vb[System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.MenuEditors#4](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_WebNet/System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.MenuEditors/VB/MenuEditors.vb#4)]

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor(class System.Type type) cil managed

Docs.param: The of the collection to edit.
Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The .NET Framework internally constructs a new instance of the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.MenuItemStyleCollectionEditor> class when you select, for example, the ellipsis button (**…**) on the **LevelMenuItemStyles** or **LevelSelectedStyles** row in the **Properties** grid of the visual designer when designing a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Menu> control or a control that is derived from the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Menu> class.

MemberSignature.Value: .method familyhidebysig virtual instance bool CanSelectMultipleInstances() cil managed

Docs.summary: Gets a value indicating whether multiple elements can be selected in the editor at one time.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.MenuItemStyleCollectionEditor.CanSelectMultipleInstances%2A> method always returns `false`; thus, only one <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.MenuItemStyle> object can be selected at a time in the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.MenuItemStyleCollectionEditor> object.

MemberSignature.Value: .method familyhidebysig virtual instance class System.ComponentModel.Design.CollectionEditor/CollectionForm CreateCollectionForm() cil managed

Docs.summary: Creates a new form to display and edit the current object.
Docs.returns: An instance of the to use as the .

remarks.format: ## Remarks The <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.MenuItemStyleCollectionEditor.CreateCollectionForm%2A> method calls the <xref:System.ComponentModel.Design.CollectionEditor.CreateCollectionForm%2A> base method to create the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.MenuItemStyleCollectionEditor> form, and then formats a caption for the form.

MemberSignature.Value: .method familyhidebysig virtual instance object CreateInstance(class System.Type itemType) cil managed

Docs.summary: Creates a new instance of the specified collection item type.
Docs.returns: A new instance of the specified type, .

remarks.format: ## Remarks The <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.MenuItemStyleCollectionEditor.CreateInstance%2A> method is used to create new <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.MenuItemStyle> objects. The <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.MenuItemStyleCollectionEditor.CreateInstance%2A> calls the <xref:System.Activator.CreateInstance%2A> method to access the activation methods for late-bound support.

MemberSignature.Value: .method familyhidebysig virtual instance class System.Type[] CreateNewItemTypes() cil managed

Docs.summary: Gets the data types that this collection editor can create.
Docs.returns: A type array of the data types the can create.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.MenuItemStyleCollectionEditor> object can create <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.MenuItemStyle> type objects.
